TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The Government are represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In the beginning of the DATE ’s the applicant owned and ran several private limited companies . He was also employed in a leading position in a private limited company , called ORG , which was not owned by him .

On DATE the applicant was arrested and charged with bribery . A search was carried out at his home and office , during which CARDINAL files were seized . On DATE ORG of GPE ( ORG ) remanded the applicant in custody . He , a cosuspect N , who was the managing director of ORG , and CARDINAL witnesses were heard , subsequent to which on DATE the applicant was released . On DATE the applicant was informed that he was also suspected of instigating a breach of trust . During DATE the investigation authorities went through various documents and heard witnesses and , on DATE , the preliminary investigation report , which ran to CARDINAL pages , was communicated to the applicant who was given until DATE to submit comments and request additional investigative measures . At the applicant ’s request , the time - limit was extended until DATE and he was re - heard on DATE . N was also re - heard .

On DATE the prosecution submitted an indictment to ORG containing CARDINAL counts . The first count concerned bribery alleging that the applicant in DATE , representing a private limited company , bought shares on CARDINAL occasions from and via N in the company ORG . The shares were sold at a price exceeding the real value by MONEY ( SEK ) , equivalent to MONEY ( ORG ) , in order to procure an improper profit for ORG was charged with taking the bribe . The second count concerned instigating a gross breach of trust , alleging that the applicant had made N grant the applicant ’s private limited company an irregular loan from ORG to pay the bribe . The loan was covered up by misleading book - keeping . By granting the loan , N abused his position as managing director of ORG , to the detriment of his principal , and he was also charged with a gross breach of trust .
On DATE ORG invited the applicant to state within DATE what evidence he wished to submit . The information was submitted by the applicant on DATE , DATE .

On DATE ORG scheduled the hearing to be held on DATE . On DATE N requested that the hearing be adjourned . The applicant did not object . Instead the hearing was held on DATE during which the applicant , N and CARDINAL witnesses were heard and extensive written material submitted .

By judgment of DATE , ORG convicted the applicant and N , in accordance with the indictment , pursuant to LAW ( brottsbalken ) chapter DATE , chapter DATE and chapter LAW . However , as regards the second count , it did not consider that the circumstances were sufficiently serious to be qualified as “ gross ” . The applicant and N were each sentenced to DATE imprisonment .
On DATE , the applicant appealed against the judgment to ORG ( Hovrätten för Nedre Norrland ) . N also appealed .

On DATE ORG scheduled a hearing for CARDINAL and DATE . On DATE , N requested that the hearing be adjourned as he wished to call a new witness who would be in GPE at that time . The applicant informed the court that he too wished to call that witness . Their request was granted and the hearing rescheduled for CARDINAL and DATE . On DATE the prosecutor submitted the records from interviews held by the police with this witness . The following day , N requested that the hearing be adjourned as he did not have sufficient time to go through the new documentation . The applicant and the prosecutor did not object and , accordingly , the hearing was re - scheduled for CARDINAL and DATE . During the hearing the applicant , N , and CARDINAL witnesses were heard and extensive written material submitted , including new material submitted by the applicant and a statement from an expert witness relied on by N.
On DATE the judgment was upheld by ORG , which stated inter alia :

“ The penal value of the crimes of which [ the applicant and N ] have been found guilty clearly exceeds DATE imprisonment . No personal circumstances with regard to [ the applicant and N ] have emerged which constitute sufficient reasons for choosing any other sanction than imprisonment . As the district ORG has found , both of them shall therefore be sentenced to imprisonment .

Certainly , between the commission of the crimes and the sentencing , a longer period of time has elapsed than appears justifiable by reference to the nature and scope of the crimes . However , even in view of this and of what has further emerged in the case , ORG finds that the sentences determined by ORG appear well balanced . ”

On DATE the applicant and N requested leave to appeal to ORG ) . In the period DATE and DATE , the applicant and N were granted a number of extensions of the time - limits to submit their grounds of appeal . The applicant submitted his grounds of appeal on DATE . The applicant claimed that he completed his appeal on DATE . The Government claimed that the applicant did not complete his appeal until DATE . It is undisputed , however , that he submitted his claim for legal costs on the latter date . N completed his appeal on CARDINAL DATE and submitted his claim for legal costs on DATE . On DATE ORG refused leave to appeal .
